<p><strong>Carbon dioxide (CO₂):</strong> greenhouse gas. It is the main cause of global warming.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=O=S=O">
  <img src="dióxido de enxofre.png" alt="Dióxido de enxofre" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Sulfur dioxide (SO₂):</strong>polluting gas that contributes to the formation of acid rain.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=nitrate">
  <img src="Nitrato.png" alt="Nitrato" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Nitrate (NO₃⁻):</strong> present in fertilizers. In excess, it causes eutrophication of rivers and lakes.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=ozone">
  <img src="ozonio.png" alt="Ozônio" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Ozone  (O₃):</strong> protects against UV radiation in the stratosphere, but acts as a pollutant in the troposphere.</p>
